questions.question_text: Which of the following should be the MAIN governance focus when implementing a newly approved bring your own device (BYOD) policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Educating employees on the increased IT security risk to the enterprise

When implementing a newly approved bring your own device (BYOD) policy, the main governance focus should be on educating employees on the increased IT security risk to the enterprise. BYOD policies introduce new challenges and risks to IT security due to the diversity of devices and potential vulnerabilities.

Educating employees about these risks, including the importance of password protection, data encryption, secure network connections, and adherence to company policies, is crucial to mitigate potential security threats. Employees need to understand their role in maintaining the security of company data and systems when using their personal devices for work purposes.

questions.question_text: Which of the following roles should be responsible for data normalization when it is found that a new system includes duplicates of data items?

comments.content:
Data Governance and Compliance: Data stewards play a key role in establishing and enforcing data governance policies and procedures. They ensure that data management practices align with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and organizational objectives. They may also assist in audits and compliance assessments related to data management and governance.

Data Integration and Interoperability: Data stewards facilitate data integration and interoperability efforts across different systems and platforms within the organization. They collaborate with IT teams and business units to ensure that data is accurately and efficiently exchanged between systems while maintaining data consistency and integrity.

From the perspective of CGEIT (Certified in the Governance of Enterprise IT), the role of a data steward involves several key responsibilities related to data governance and management within an organization.
Data Quality Management: Data stewards are responsible for ensuring the quality and integrity of data across the organization. This includes defining and maintaining data quality standards, monitoring data quality metrics, and implementing processes to address data quality issues.

Data Lifecycle Management: Data stewards oversee the entire lifecycle of data within the organization, from creation and capture to archival or deletion. They establish policies and procedures for data retention, storage, and disposal in accordance with regulatory requirements and business needs.

Data Classification and Security: Data stewards classify data based on its sensitivity, criticality, and confidentiality levels. They work closely with information security teams to ensure that appropriate security controls are in place to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or misuse.

Selected Answer: D
The role that should be responsible for data normalization when duplicates of data items are found in a new system is the Data steward (Option D). A Data steward is typically responsible for ensuring the quality, integrity, and proper management of data within an organization. Data normalization involves the process of organizing and structuring data to eliminate redundancies and inconsistencies.

B. Database administrator (DBA)

The responsibility for data normalization, especially when dealing with duplicates of data items in a new system, typically falls under the purview of the Database Administrator (DBA). Data normalization involves organizing data in a database efficiently to reduce redundancy and improve data integrity.

DBAs are responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of databases. They have the expertise and knowledge required to analyze database structures, identify duplicate data items, and implement normalization techniques to ensure data consistency and efficiency.
